intro: Stomatanthes corumbensis, commonly known as the Corumbá water lily, is a aquatic plant native to South America. It is characterized by its broad, floating leaves that provide a habitat for various aquatic organisms. The plant has a showy, white to pinkish flower that blooms above the water surface. Its roots are anchored in the mud at the bottom of shallow water bodies. Stomatanthes corumbensis plays an important role in maintaining water quality and supporting local biodiversity.
